snippet: In five months at the end of last year, doctors and other health care professionals made more than $212 million on speaking and consulting engagements for drug and device makers.
abstract: Newly released data shows that doctors and other health care professionals earned more than $212 million on speaking and consulting engagements from drug and device makers in the last five months of 2013; data, culled from federal database mandated under new health care law, is likely to draw intense scrutiny into the murky financial ties between physicians and the health care industry.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and RACHEL ABRAMS
byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen and Agustin Armendariz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In five months at the end of last year, doctors and other health care professionals made more than $212 million on speaking and consulting engagements for drug and device makers.

headline.main: Financial Ties Between Doctors and Health Care Firms Are Detailed
headline.print_headline: Financial Ties Between Doctors and Health Care Firms Detailed

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
